text.p: These are the leading stories in the Namibian press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Police are to launch a new investigation into illegal purchases of ostriches and their eggs, allegedly involving Deputy Environment and Tourism Minister Nangolo Ithete, who was cleared last week on the charge when witnesses retracted their evidence.
- Employees of the coastal offices of the Ministry of Fisheries and Marine Resources are demanding an urgent salary review.
- A light plane carrying five people on a sightseeing flight over the Namib desert went missing and failed to reach its destination.
- The Council of Churches of Namibia is to launch a year of activities with an ecumenical service on Sunday aimed at continuing the process of reconciliation in Namibia.
- Water in the Swakop river has reached the sea for the first time since 1984, after good rains.
